channel.title: Histogram on Data Science by Gillian McNally
channel.description: Recent content in Histogram on Data Science by Gillian McNally

item.title: Histograms
item.description: Welcome back we are going to try a Histogram example! Alright, in this example we will look at the weights of MLB players through the Master table in the Lahman database.` Make sure you have the following applications ready to work with: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) This request uses the Master table to gather its data. query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) Letâ€™s try it out using our handy tool ggplot2! ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight),color="blue",fill="white",bins=60)+ ggtitle("Distribution of Baseball Player Bodyweight")+ xlab("Weight of player")+ ylab("Number of players") ## Warning: Removed 854 rows containing non-finite values (stat_bin).
